description: Demolition of existing pair of semi-detached, two storey properties, and replacement with a six storey building incoporating Retail uses (A1/A2/A3 Use Classes) at ground floor level (261.5 sqm net), and nine residential units (7x 2 bedroom flats and 2x 3 bedroom flats) over the upper five floor levels, integrated balconies, bicycle storage, and refuse and recycling storage areas
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 801/01; 801/06; 801/07; 801/08; 801/09; 801/10; 801/11; 801/12; 801/13; 801/14 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | All residential dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 7, policy 7.2 of The London Plan, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved details of the refuse and recycling facility shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained in perpetuity.   Reason:  To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:  "	Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking; "	Details of demolition and construction hours; "	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures; "	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials; "	Details of temporary lighting; "	Dust suppression and monitoring measures, having regard to BRE guide 'Control of Dust from Construction and Demolition Activities'; "	Wheel wash measures "	Site security during construction "	Tree protection "	A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including "	controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; "	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents  The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.11, 4.12 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004/2007). | Full details of both hard and soft landscape works, together with a 5 year management plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained thereafter. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To enhance the character of the area and ensure a satisfactory visual appearance to the development in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies LV.7.4 and 7B of the 'Publication Version' Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of any part of the development hereby approved details of a communal outdoor amenity space at the first floor level above the existing retail unit shall be submitted for the approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be implemented in full.   Reason: To provide the residential units, and especially the family sized units, with a suitable sized outdoor amenity space in accordance with policies 3.4 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2011 and saved policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan. | Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, full details (including the siting) of the mechanical plant and equipment, flues and air moving equipment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be implemented in full.   Reason: To protect the amenity of future occupiers and neighbouring residential properties in accordance with saved policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan, and policies 3.4 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2011, and policy 7B of the Publication Version Development Management Plan Document | No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Thames Water.   Reason: The proposed works maybe in close proximity to underground sewerage utility infrastructure | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no residents of the flat shall obtain resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 6.13 and 8.2 the London Plan (2011).
